Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) often lacks the specificity needed to accurately infer tissue pathology. Our research is focused on developing advanced MRI techniques that provide a non-invasive look into pathological tissue processes. We have a particular interest in multiple sclerosis, which is characterized by highly variable tissue pathology.
